meta.title: CLI Plan – Initiative Task Queue (Workflow Foundations: BL-0004..BL-0008)
notes: This queue converts backlog items BL-0004..BL-0008 into an executable, dependency-aware task list.
Each task is intended to be a single-owner, single-PR unit of work with concrete verification commands.
Dependencies are directional and explicit (contract/spec tasks block implementation tasks).

phases.title: Planning
goals: Decompose BL-0004..BL-0008 into small, executable tasks.
Make contract/spec dependencies explicit before implementation.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0004 Bounded Planning Default (v1)
goals: Make bounded planning the default sprint model for v1.
Ensure `ph init` seeds bounded defaults and `ph sprint plan` is defensively bounded when config omits sprint settings.
Keep timeboxed mode supported but opt-in and test-backed.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0005 Enforce DR-First Decision Workflow (DR → ADR/FDR)
goals: Enforce that discovery tasks produce DRs and execution tasks reference ADR/FDR (not DR).
Add validation for DR existence and ADR/FDR backlinks to DR(s).
Add scaffolding helpers: `ph dr add` (and `ph fdr add` if needed) while keeping `ph` deterministic.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0006 Release Plan Slot Goals + Enablement (Release Drives Sprints)
goals: Require release plans to specify per-slot goals/enablement and intended gates.
Auto-populate sprint plans from release slot goals when a release is active and a slot is assigned.
Validate/surface misalignment in status and lint/validate.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0007 First-Class Task Types + Sessions
goals: Add explicit `task_type` to task.yaml with a defined taxonomy and backwards-compatible defaults.
Add `ph task create --type <task_type>` with sensible scaffolding defaults.
Seed additional session templates and enforce type/session consistency in lint/validate.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0008 Require Sprint Gates for Every Sprint (Sprint Goal Gating)
goals: Require at least one sprint gate task per sprint with explicit evidence-friendly acceptance criteria.
Surface gate readiness in `ph sprint status` and enforce via `ph pre-exec lint`.
Block `ph sprint close` when sprint gates are missing or incomplete (with explicit override semantics if allowed).

workstreams.title: Planning
notes: Typically completed once, then other workstreams can proceed.

workstreams.title: BL-0004 — Bounded Sprint Default
workstreams.concurrency: Can run in parallel with WS-I05/WS-I06; touches sprint/init behavior.
notes: Contract/spec first, then code, then tests.
May conflict with WS-I07/WS-I08 if both modify sprint semantics; rely on depends_on for behavioral coupling.

workstreams.title: BL-0005 — DR-First Workflow (DR → ADR/FDR)
workstreams.concurrency: Can run in parallel with WS-I04/WS-I06; touches decision docs + adr/fdr/dr commands + validation.
notes: Lock explicit contract outputs (flags/paths/backlink rules) before implementation.

workstreams.title: BL-0006 — Release Slot Goals + Enablement
workstreams.concurrency: Can run in parallel with WS-I04/WS-I05; touches release scaffold + sprint scaffold + validation/status.
notes: Contract defines deterministic headings/markers used by parsing/validation.

workstreams.title: BL-0007 — Task Types + Sessions
workstreams.concurrency: Can run in parallel with WS-I04/WS-I05/WS-I06; blocks WS-I08 via explicit depends_on.
notes: Defines taxonomy/mapping; unblocks sprint-gate enforcement work.

workstreams.title: BL-0008 — Sprint Gates Required
workstreams.concurrency: Starts after WS-I07 contract foundations; then can proceed largely independently.
notes: Enforcement spans sprint status, pre-exec lint, sprint close, and validate.

tasks.title: Plan: decompose BL-0004..BL-0008 into executable tasks
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Convert backlog items BL-0004..BL-0008 (bounded sprint default, DR-first workflow, release slot goals, task types/sessions, sprint gates) into an executable task queue.

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/tasks_initiatives_bl_0004_bl_0008.json

Verification steps:
- Validate JSON: `python -m json.tool cli_plan/tasks_initiatives_bl_0004_bl_0008.json`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Each initiative has an ordered, dependency-aware list of small tasks.
- Each task has a concrete Goal, likely files, verification commands, and pass/fail acceptance criteria.

tasks.title: Contract: bounded planning is the v1 default sprint model (timeboxed is opt-in)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Feature brief (BL-0004): New repos should default to bounded sprint planning (ADR-0013), and `ph sprint plan` should produce bounded plans unless the repo explicitly opts into timeboxed mode.

Assumptions:
- Bounded mode is the safe default for v1.
- Timeboxed mode remains supported but requires explicit configuration.

Goal:
- Update contract/spec docs so defaults and override semantics are unambiguous.

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/sprints/contract.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/sprints/examples/** (if examples are used as executable references)

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Document that v1 default is `sprint_management.mode = bounded`.
- Document opt-in for timeboxed (exact config keys and allowed values).
- Document defensive fallback behavior when `validation_rules.json` exists but omits `sprint_management`.

Verification steps:
- Doc review for internal consistency.
- Grep: `rg -n "sprint_management\.mode|bounded|timeboxed" cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/sprints/contract.md`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Contract text clearly states the default and the opt-in override (no ambiguity).
- Spec describes the exact config key and allowed values.

tasks.title: Code: seed bounded sprint defaults in `ph init` validation_rules.json
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Ensure `ph init` seeds `.project-handbook/process/checks/validation_rules.json` with `sprint_management.mode = "bounded"` so the default is explicit.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/init_repo.py

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Add a `sprint_management` section to `_DEFAULT_VALIDATION_RULES` with at least:
  - `mode: "bounded"`
  - (optional) any existing bounded defaults already assumed by code (`health_check_thresholds`, `sprint_duration_days`) if they should live in validation_rules.json.
- Preserve non-destructive behavior: existing validation_rules.json is not overwritten.

Verification steps:
- Unit/integration: run init in a temp dir and inspect generated JSON.
- `uv run pytest -q` (targeted tests if added).

Acceptance criteria:
- Fresh `ph init` repo includes `sprint_management.mode` set to `bounded` in validation_rules.json.
- No behavior changes for repos that already have explicit sprint_management config.

tasks.title: Code: make `ph sprint plan` default to bounded when sprint config is missing
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Make `ph sprint plan` produce bounded plans when `validation_rules.json` exists but omits `sprint_management` (defensive fallback).

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/sprint.py

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- In `create_sprint_plan_template`, treat missing/empty `sprint_management.mode` as `bounded` (not `timeboxed`).
- Keep validation: if mode is set but invalid, fall back to bounded (and optionally warn in output).
- Ensure timeboxed mode still works when explicitly configured.

Verification steps:
- Create a repo with validation_rules.json missing `sprint_management` and run `ph sprint plan`; verify `mode: bounded` and no `start/end` fields.
- Create a repo with `sprint_management.mode=timeboxed`; verify `start/end` are present.
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Missing sprint_management results in bounded mode plans.
- Explicit timeboxed config generates timeboxed plans.

tasks.title: Tests: bounded default sprint plan behavior (init + sprint plan)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Add test coverage so bounded default behavior does not regress.

Files likely to change:
- tests/ (new or existing sprint/init tests)

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Test that a fresh `ph init` repo produces bounded plans by default.
- Test that a repo with validation_rules.json present but missing `sprint_management` still produces bounded plans.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Tests fail on old behavior and pass on new behavior.

tasks.title: Tests: timeboxed sprint plans are opt-in and include start/end
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Preserve timeboxed mode as an explicit opt-in.

Files likely to change:
- tests/ (sprint plan tests)

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Add a test repo config that sets `sprint_management.mode = timeboxed`.
- Assert that generated sprint plan includes `mode: timeboxed` and `start:` / `end:`.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Timeboxed only occurs when explicitly configured.

tasks.title: Contract: enforce DR-first workflow and define DR↔ADR/FDR linking invariants
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Feature brief (BL-0005): Discovery is captured in Decision Register (DR) entries, which are then promoted into ADRs (cross-cutting) or FDRs (feature-scoped). Enforce that discovery tasks reference DRs, execution tasks reference ADR/FDR, and ADR/FDR must link back to DR(s).

Goal:
- Document the strict workflow invariants and the CLI command surface changes needed to support them.

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/decision-register/contract.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/adr/contract.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/features/contract.md

Outputs (must be explicit after this task):
- Exact CLI synopses (copy/paste-ready) for:
  - `ph dr add ...`
  - `ph adr add ... --dr DR-#### ...`
  - `ph fdr add ... --dr DR-#### ...`
- Exact DR backlink rule for ADR/FDR docs:
  - which front matter field holds backlinks (recommend `links:`)
  - required backlink format (MUST be a repo-relative path to a DR markdown file, not just an id)
- Exact DR existence rule for validation:
  - searched directories (project-level vs feature-level)
  - how `feature:` in task.yaml affects DR lookup
- Exact FDR conventions:
  - required front matter keys (at minimum `id`, `type`, `date`, and backlink field)
  - allowed `id` shapes (must start with `FDR-`)
  - file path where FDRs live

Behaviors to implement/adjust (contract/spec):
- Discovery tasks (`session=research-discovery`) MUST use `decision: DR-XXXX`.
- Execution tasks (`session=task-execution`) MUST use `decision: ADR-XXXX` or `decision: FDR-...`.
- DR existence rule: referenced DR ids must have a corresponding DR doc in project-level or feature-level decision-register.
- Backlink rule: ADR/FDR front matter MUST include at least one DR backlink as defined above.
- Command surface:
  - Add `ph dr add` (DR scaffolding).
  - Update `ph adr add` to require `--dr DR-####` and write the DR backlink.
  - Add `ph fdr add` to require `--dr DR-####` and write the DR backlink.

Verification steps:
- Doc review for consistency across contracts.

Acceptance criteria:
- CLI_CONTRACT.md + spec contracts include the explicit synopses and exact backlink/existence rules (no placeholder language).
- The DR backlink rule is deterministic (a concrete path pattern) and implementable in lint/validate.

tasks.title: Code: enforce session↔decision semantics (research-discovery uses DR; task-execution uses ADR/FDR)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Enforce strict decision id semantics in lint/validate.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/pre_exec.py
- src/ph/validate_docs.py
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- `ph pre-exec lint` fails if:
  - `session: research-discovery` task uses `ADR-`/`FDR-` decision ids (must be `DR-XXXX`).
  - `session: task-execution` task uses a `DR-` decision id (must be `ADR-` or `FDR-`).
- Error messages are actionable (include expected vs found).

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q` (targeted tests).

Acceptance criteria:
- Lint/validate behavior matches the contract rules and has test coverage.

tasks.title: Code: validate DR existence + ADR/FDR backlinks to DR(s)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Add deterministic validation rules so DR-first workflow is enforceable.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/validate_docs.py
- src/ph/task_create.py (optional: reuse decision resolution helpers)
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- When a task references `DR-XXXX`, `ph validate` must confirm a corresponding DR doc exists in:
  - `.project-handbook/decision-register/` OR
  - `.project-handbook/features/<feature>/decision-register/`.
- For ADR and FDR docs, validate that their YAML front matter `links:` includes at least one DR path.
- Validation errors include:
  - the missing DR id and the searched directories
  - the ADR/FDR doc path missing backlinks

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph validate` reports actionable errors for missing DR docs and missing ADR/FDR→DR backlinks.

tasks.title: Code: add `ph dr add` scaffolding command (project-level or feature-scoped)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Introduce `ph dr add` to scaffold a new DR entry.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/cli.py
- src/ph/dr/add.py (new)
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Command creates `DR-XXXX-<slug>.md` in the correct decision-register folder based on flags (as defined in contract).
- File includes required front matter and the standard DR body template.
- CLI refuses to overwrite existing files unless `--force` is provided.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.
- Manual: run `ph dr add ...` in a temp handbook root and confirm file path/content.

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph dr add` produces a DR file that passes `ph validate --quick`.

tasks.title: Code: require DR reference for `ph adr add` and write backlink into `links:`
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Update `ph adr add` to enforce DR-first workflow.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/adr/add.py
- src/ph/cli.py
- tests/

Inputs/outputs:
- Input: DR-first contract outputs from I05-DRWF-0001 (explicit CLI synopsis + backlink rule).
- Output: `ph adr add` requires `--dr DR-####` and writes a DR backlink into the ADR front matter.

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- CLI requires `--dr DR-####` (missing flag is an error).
- CLI validates the referenced DR exists before creating the ADR.
- ADR front matter backlink field (recommend `links:`) includes the DR markdown path (repo-relative path as specified in I05-DRWF-0001).
- Do not provide an override mode: missing DR reference is a hard error (this is a strict workflow gate).

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- ADRs created via CLI include the DR backlink and pass `ph validate --quick`.
- Missing/invalid `--dr` fails with an actionable error message.

tasks.title: Code: add `ph fdr add` (feature decision record) requiring DR backlink
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Introduce `ph fdr add` to create feature-scoped durable decisions, enforcing DR backlink.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/cli.py
- src/ph/fdr/add.py (new)
- src/ph/feature.py (if feature scaffolding needs FDR folder guarantees)
- tests/

Inputs/outputs:
- Input: FDR conventions + DR backlink rule written by I05-DRWF-0001.
- Output: `ph fdr add --feature <feature> --id <FDR-...> --title <t> --dr DR-####` creates a new markdown file under `.project-handbook/features/<feature>/fdr/` with required front matter and DR backlink.

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- CLI requires:
  - `--feature <feature>`
  - `--id <FDR-...>` (must start with `FDR-`)
  - `--title <t>`
  - `--dr DR-####`
- CLI validates the referenced DR exists before creating the FDR.
- FDR front matter includes:
  - `id: <FDR-...>`
  - `type: <exact type from contract>`
  - `date: YYYY-MM-DD`
  - backlink field (recommend `links:`) that includes the DR markdown path.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph fdr add` produces an FDR doc that passes `ph validate --quick`.
- Missing/invalid inputs fail with actionable errors (including missing DR).

tasks.title: Tests: DR-first workflow enforcement (lint + validate + dr/adr/fdr add)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Ensure DR-first workflow is test-backed and stable.

Files likely to change:
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Add tests for:
  - pre-exec lint session↔decision enforcement
  - validate DR existence checks
  - validate ADR/FDR backlink requirements
  - `ph dr add`, `ph adr add --dr ...`, `ph fdr add --dr ...`

Verification steps:

Acceptance criteria:

tasks.title: Contract: release plans must include per-slot goal/enablement + gate intentions; sprints must link explicitly
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Feature brief (BL-0006): Release plans must define the goal of each sprint slot and how it enables/moves the release forward; sprint plans should pull these slot goals forward; validation/status should surface misalignment.

Goal:
- Define the required release plan slot section format and the required sprint plan alignment structure so validation can be deterministic.

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/releases/contract.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/sprints/contract.md

Outputs (must be explicit after this task):
- Release plan slot section structure (exact headings/markers), for example:
  - `## Slot <n>: <label>`
  - `### Slot Goal`
  - `### Enablement`
  - `### Scope Boundaries` (with `In scope:` / `Out of scope:`)
  - `### Intended Gates` (MUST contain at least one list item that starts with `- Gate:`)
- Sprint plan alignment section structure (exact headings/markers), for example:
  - `## Release Alignment (Slot <n>)`
  - `Slot goal: ...`
  - `Enablement: ...`
  - `Intended gates:` list

Behaviors to implement/adjust (contract/spec):
- Release plans MUST include a slot section for each slot in the release timeline, using the exact structure above.
- Sprint plans (when `release` is active and `release_sprint_slot` is set) MUST include the sprint alignment section above.
- Validation MUST be able to detect missing/malformed sections deterministically by looking for those headings/markers.

Verification steps:
- Doc review + consistency scan.

Acceptance criteria:
- Contracts include the exact headings/markers for release slots and sprint alignment (no placeholders).

tasks.title: Code: extend `ph release plan` scaffold with required per-slot sections (goal/enablement/gates)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Update the release plan scaffold to include required section skeleton per slot.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/release.py
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- When timeline_mode is sprint_slots, scaffold each slot with a consistent structure:
  - Slot header
  - Goal / Purpose
  - Scope boundaries (in/out)
  - Intended gate(s)
  - Enablement (how it advances the release)
- Preserve non-destructive behavior: do not overwrite existing plan.md.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.
- Manual: `ph release plan --version vX.Y.Z --sprints N` and inspect plan.md.

Acceptance criteria:
- Plan contains required slot sections with placeholders for each slot.

tasks.title: Code: auto-populate sprint plan goal + release alignment from active release slot
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: When a release is active and a sprint slot is assigned, `ph sprint plan` pulls slot goal/enablement into the sprint plan scaffold.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/sprint.py
- src/ph/release.py (helpers to parse slot sections)
- tests/

Inputs/outputs:
- Input: Release plan has per-slot sections with exact headings/markers defined by I06-RLSLOT-0001.
- Output: Sprint plan contains `## Release Alignment (Slot <n>)` with:
  - `Slot goal: <text>`
  - `Enablement: <text>`
  - `Intended gates:` list copied from the release plan slot.

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Parse the active release plan and extract the assigned slot's `Slot Goal`, `Enablement`, and `Intended Gates` content.
- Populate the sprint plan section `## Release Alignment (Slot <n>)` at scaffold time.
- Keep human authorship: do not rewrite existing plan bodies; only scaffold at creation time unless `--force`.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- New sprint plans include slot-derived goal/enablement and intended gate list when a release is active.

tasks.title: Code: surface slot goals and slot alignment in `ph release status` / `ph release progress`
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Make release status outputs show slot goals/current slot and detect mismatches.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/release.py
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Display per-slot goal summaries and highlight the current slot.
- Warn when the active sprint is missing/mismatched `release_sprint_slot` or missing required alignment markers.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q` (targeted tests).

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph release status` / `ph release progress` show slot goal context and warnings for misalignment.

tasks.title: Code: validate release slot sections + sprint alignment markers
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Add validation to enforce release→sprint alignment.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/validate_docs.py
- tests/

Inputs/outputs:
- Input: Deterministic headings/markers defined by I06-RLSLOT-0001.
- Output: Validation errors that point to the missing section/marker.

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Validate release plan includes a `## Slot <n>:` section for each slot.
- Validate each slot has a `### Intended Gates` subsection that contains at least one list item starting with `- Gate:`.
- Validate that a sprint assigned to a slot contains a `## Release Alignment (Slot <n>)` section.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph validate` reports actionable errors when slot sections/markers are missing or malformed.

tasks.title: Tests: release slot scaffolding, sprint auto-population, and alignment validation
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Lock in BL-0006 behavior with focused tests.

tasks.title: Contract: define `task_type` taxonomy and session mapping (backwards compatible)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Feature brief (BL-0007): Introduce explicit task types tied to onboarding session templates. Add at least: `sprint-gate`, `feature-research-planning`, `task-docs-deep-dive`.

Goal:
- Define allowed task types, defaults for legacy tasks, and deterministic mapping to sessions + lint/validate rules.

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/sprints/contract.md

Outputs (must be explicit after this task):
- Allowed `task_type` values (explicit list) and default when missing.
- Allowed `session` values (explicit list) and a mapping table:
  - `task_type` → `session` (or allowed set)
- Deterministic per-type lint/validate rules expressed as concrete requirements, not vague adjectives. For example:
  - sprint-gate tasks MUST include the literal `Sprint Goal:` in `validation.md` and MUST mention `secret-scan.txt`.
  - task-docs-deep-dive tasks MUST NOT contain words: `implement`, `refactor`, `deploy`, `ship` (case-insensitive) in `steps.md` and `validation.md`.
  - feature-research-planning tasks MUST contain headings `## Contract updates` and `## Execution tasks to create` in `steps.md`.

Behaviors to implement/adjust (contract/spec):
- Add `task_type: <string>` to task.yaml schema with allowed values.
- Define default when `task_type` is missing.
- Define mapping from `task_type` → required/allowed `session` value(s).
- Define deterministic doc expectations per type (exact required strings/headings and forbidden tokens/phrases).

Verification steps:
- Doc review.

Acceptance criteria:
- Contract/spec include the explicit lists and mapping table, plus deterministic per-type lint rules that can be implemented as string/heading checks.

Acceptance criteria:

tasks.title: Tests: `ph task create --type` + init template seeding + lint/validate mapping
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Ensure BL-0007 behaviors are stable and regression-proof.

Files likely to change:

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Add tests for:
  - init seeding of new session templates
  - task create writes task_type and correct session defaults
  - validate catches mismatched task_type/session
  - pre-exec lint type-specific rules

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Tests cover each new type and legacy behavior.

tasks.title: Contract: define sprint gate requirement and close behavior (including evidence expectations)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Feature brief (BL-0008): Every sprint must include at least one sprint gate task that validates sprint goals and provides evidence-friendly exit criteria. Sprint close should warn/block when gates are missing or incomplete.

Goal:
- Define gate semantics (task_type, acceptance criteria requirements, evidence paths, relationship to release gates) and how enforcement works in lint/status/close.

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/sprints/contract.md
- cli_plan/ph_spec/ph/releases/contract.md

Outputs (must be explicit after this task):
- Exact definition of a sprint gate task:
  - `task_type: sprint-gate`
  - expected `session` value (from I07-TTYPE-0001 mapping table)
- Deterministic gate-doc requirements that can be implemented as string/heading checks, for example (choose exact rules and write them down):
  - Gate tasks MUST include the literal `Sprint Goal:` in `validation.md` (or another exact file, but specify which).
  - Gate tasks MUST mention `secret-scan.txt` (already required by pre-exec lint globally; keep it explicit in gate docs).
  - Gate tasks MUST reference the sprint plan path `sprints/current/plan.md` (or a relative link) so the goal can be traced.
- Close semantics:
  - default: block `ph sprint close` when no sprint-gate tasks exist or when any sprint-gate task is not `done`
  - if override exists: exact flag name + messaging
- Release relationship:
  - how sprint gates relate to `release_gate` tasks when `release` is active

Behaviors to implement/adjust (contract/spec):
- Sprint must have >=1 task with `task_type: sprint-gate`.
- Gate tasks must meet the deterministic gate-doc requirements defined above.
- Define `ph sprint close` behavior per the explicit semantics above.

Verification steps:
- Doc review for consistency.

Acceptance criteria:
- Contract specifies sprint-gate semantics and gate-doc requirements as concrete markers/strings/headings.
- Close behavior is explicit (block vs override) and implementable without additional decisions.

tasks.title: Code: show gate readiness in `ph sprint status` (list gate tasks + dependency-ready + status)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Make sprint status surface sprint gate tasks and readiness.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/sprint_status.py
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Identify tasks with `task_type: sprint-gate`.
- Print a dedicated gate section:
  - gate task id/title
  - status
  - dependency-ready boolean
- When no gates exist, show an explicit warning line.

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph sprint status` clearly shows whether the sprint is gate-ready.

tasks.title: Code: enforce sprint gate presence and gate doc requirements in `ph pre-exec lint`
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Add strict sprint gate enforcement in pre-exec lint.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/pre_exec.py
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Fail lint if current sprint has no `task_type: sprint-gate` tasks.
- For each sprint-gate task, fail lint if required gate statements are missing:
  - explicit reference to sprint goal(s)
  - explicit evidence artifacts, including `secret-scan.txt`
- Error messages must be actionable (which task, which file, what is missing).

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Lint fails on missing gates and passes when gate tasks meet requirements.

tasks.title: Code: block `ph sprint close` when sprint gates are missing or incomplete
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Prevent silent sprint closure without completing sprint gates.

Files likely to change:
- src/ph/sprint_close.py
- tests/

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Before archiving/closing, detect gate tasks (`task_type: sprint-gate`) in the sprint.
- Block close if:
  - no gate tasks exist, OR
  - any gate task is not `done`.
- If an override is allowed, implement it explicitly and document it (flag name + messaging).

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- Sprint close refuses to proceed when gates are missing/incomplete (unless explicit override is used and documented).

tasks.title: Code: validate sprint gate semantics in `ph validate` (gate tasks + required markers)

Inputs/outputs:

- Output: Validation errors that cite the missing gate task(s) or missing required gate-doc markers.

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Validate that each sprint contains at least one sprint-gate task (`task_type: sprint-gate`).
- Validate that sprint-gate tasks satisfy the deterministic gate-doc requirements from I08-GATE-0001 (exact file + required strings/headings).

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q`.

Acceptance criteria:
- `ph validate` reports actionable errors for missing gates or missing gate-doc markers.

tasks.title: Tests: sprint gate enforcement across status/lint/close/validate
